OdorMask Technology conquers bed-wetting odors continuously for stress-free mornings

body.description: Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear… from Pampers, the #1 pediatrician recommended brand! Take on bedwetting accidents and wake up confident with our All-Night Leak Protection. Our exclusive Pampers LockAway Channels absorb and distribute wetness quickly & evenly for powerful protection and dryness. Our built-in OdorMask Technology activates when bedwetting accidents happen to help conquer smells—so kids can wake up feeling great each day. Ninjamas are also uniquely designed for kids with a FormFit Waistband that flexes for a sleek, underwear-like fit. Our super stealthy nighttime underwear discreetly fits around kids' waist and sides and provides breathable comfort, just like cotton underwear!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Not Alone If your child wets the bed they’re not alone. Five to seven million kids in the U.S. alone wet the bed some nights or most nights. And, although challenging, bedwetting is normal in child development and simply a part of growing up for many kids. Common Causes of Bedwetting Your child could just be a deep sleeper and not awaken to the sign of a full bladder.Their bladder may be too small to hold urine through the night, or communication between the brain and bladder is still developing.Constipation can put pressure on your child’s bladder and lead to problems both holding and emptying urine.Mild illness or stress in your child’s life can cause them to wet the bed, or it could be related to a family history of bedwetting. Tips for Managing Bedwetting Be honest—Remember it’s not your child’s fault. It’s just a normal part of some kids’ development. So be honest with your child and let them know it’s not their fault, and they’ll most likely outgrow it soon.Stay positive—Be sensitive to your child’s feelings and offer support. If you don’t make a big deal about it, chances are they won’t either.Note habits & set a routine—Be aware of your child’s daily urine and bowel habits. Limit large amounts of fluids (especially sugary and carbonated drinks) before bed and have your child use the toilet right before getting into bed. If possible wake your child 1–2 hours after going to sleep to go again.Protect their bed—Even under the best circumstances, accidents aren’t always preventable. And when they do happen, nighttime protective underwear like Ninjamas help keep your child and their bed dry while controlling urine odor. When to See Your Doctor Bedwetting is a common childhood issue, but below are some instances when you may want to talk with your doctor. Your child has been completely toilet trained for 6 months and starts wetting the bed.While urinating, your child experiences pain, burning, or strain, or dribbles after urination.You notice your child’s urine is cloudy or pink, or they have bloodstains on their underwear.Your child has both daytime and nighttime wetting or has poor bowel control.

FAQ's What sizes do Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear come in? Ninjamas are available in sizes S/M and L/XL. S/M fits children 38–70 lb. (17–32 kg), and L/XL fits children 64–125 lb. (29–57 kg). What causes bedwetting? Bedwetting is common in childhood development. It affects 5–7 million children in the U.S. alone. The causes of bedwetting vary from child to child, but the most common cause is normal bladder development. To better understand your child's bedwetting, talk with your child’s nurse or pediatrician. Is there a difference in the protection provided in the pink and green packs of Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear? Both the green and pink Ninjamas packs feature the same superior overnight absorbency with Pampers Lockaway Channels. The only difference is the nighttime underwear designs offered in each pack. So no matter which designs your child prefers, they’ll wake up feeling Ninjawesome! How do Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear absorb wetness? Absorbent gelling material (AGM) is widely used in bedtime underwear padding to absorb wetness and lock it away. It is perfectly normal to see some gel on the skin from time to time, especially if the bedtime underwear is heavily saturated. It can easily be removed by wiping your child's skin. This material has a long history of safe use in a variety of products and has been in Pampers products for more than a decade.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I highly recommend these for nighttime potty training for kids over 4 years old. They fit properly and have not had any leaks which we had been having problems with using other name brands. My child says these are also more comfortable and they are doing better night potty training than they were before which is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Way better then Pampers
reviews.reviewText: I wish I’d found out about these years ago. My almost 6 year old daughter still has occasional accidents when she sleeps. Pampers never really held in the pee that great & even though the weight range should have fit her they were too tight. And unfortunately they only go up to a certain size & that’s it.These pull ups are amazing!! They fit her soooo much better. She’s in a 7/8 clothes & the small in this size is perfect. They also hold the pee much better. Rarely does it leak out & to me they also seem a lot softer. Would definitely recommend. Switch now!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars FANTASTIC and incredibly absorbent!
reviews.reviewText: My 6-year old still experiences bed-wetting and as we all know: larger kids = larger pees. She was wearing a 6T overnight pull-up and we kept experiencing leaks that were frustrating for both of us. We tried the “Peejamas” and what a disappointment. Loads of laundry, loads of embarrassment. Enter the Ninjamas! These things DO NOT LEAK. If it weren’t so gross, I’d share a picture of her diaper from last night. She’s been sick and sleeping really deeply and it was completely full but did not leak into her pajamas or the bed. They’re amazing!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I buy these a child who is a bed wetter. We were using the Walmart off brand because they were cheaper than the goodnites we used before that, it then I discovered these and we won’t be going back, quality of the goodnites without the ridiculous price tag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for my big toddler
reviews.reviewText: These hold all of her urine and she’s pretty comfortable at night compared to the actual pull ups! These are more training underwear and more comfortable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are a great price and love that my daughter can wear them with having sensitive skin. Since birth I have had to be careful with what I but on my daughter and I am so happy that these work for her.
No leaks, nice design, daughter likes these better than pull ups. Not a fan of strong clean scent of product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thought it was a big box
reviews.reviewText: For the price, I thought I was ordering a big box. Instead, it was just a dinky, overpriced pack of 14. Stupid me for not paying attention before purchasing. You can get a big box for approximately the same price, give or take a few bucks.
These are comfortable and well made

Our daughter is 5 and still has accidents at night. We purchased these to save us from the constant bed washing daily. Well.. we had the flu hit our house and she had a different accident.. 😳 thank goodness she was wearing these.. it held it all in. Highly recommend!!
